zebra4j

Class ZebraModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • zebra4j.ZebraModel

  • @NotThreadSafe
public class ZebraModel
extends java.lang.Object
    Wrapper on ChocoSolver Model adding variable management

    This is part of the advanced API of zebra4j used when defining new kinds of Fact or AttributeType.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ZebraModel(org.chocosolver.solver.Settings chocoSettings)
      Initializes a new Zebra ChocoSolver model

    • Method Detail

      • createUniqueVariable

        public org.chocosolver.solver.variables.IntVar createUniqueVariable(Attribute attr,
                                                                    int numPeople)
        Creates a variable for an attribute that can be held by only one person in the solution

        The value of the variable is the index of the person that hold the attribute, starting at 0. Person indexes start at 0 so the index can be used in a list or array.

        Parameters:
        attr -
        numPeople -
        Returns:

      • getVariableFor

        public org.chocosolver.solver.variables.IntVar getVariableFor(Attribute uniqueAttribute)
        Finds the variable for the given unique attribute
        Parameters:
        uniqueAttribute -
        Returns:
        the variable or null if such variable was not created.

      • toOptionalAttribute

        public java.util.Optional<Attribute> toOptionalAttribute(org.chocosolver.solver.variables.IntVar var)
        Checks if a variable is for person for some attribute

        Many variables in a model are not related to people

        Parameters:
        var -
        Returns:
        the attribute, present if the variable is for the person that held the attribute

      • getChocoModel

        public org.chocosolver.solver.Model getChocoModel()
        The underlying solver Model

        We can't use IModel here because Solution.Solution(org.chocosolver.solver.Model, org.chocosolver.solver.variables.Variable...) requires Model.
